snippet: A Metro-North employee involved in a fatal accident was found to have an undiagnosed sleep apnea condition.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board offers possible medical explanation for fatal Metro-North accident on Dec 1, 2013, just north of Spuyten Duyvil station in the Bronx; train operator William Rockefeller underwent a sleep study conducted by a board certified sleep medicine physician after saying he was in a 'daze' as train gained speed, results of which indicate that he may suffer from undiagnosed severe obstructive sleep apnea.
lead_paragraph: A Metro-North employee involved in a fatal accident was found to have an undiagnosed sleep apnea condition.

headline.main: Sleep Disorder and Schedule Change Cited as Possible Factors in Train Derailment
headline.print_headline: Sleep Disorder and Schedule Change Cited as Possible Factors in Train Derailment
